page.title: 17Housing in Corby.
page.content: There is a wide variety of housing available in Corby, most of which has been built since 1945. Many of the modern estates won housing awards during their construction although now some are in need of considerable renovation and a great deal of money is having to be spent to bring them to a standard suitable for habitation. Prices in the area are considerably lower than the national average, even at the top end of the market and many surrounding villages have developed small private housing estates to cater for the executives moving to the town with new industries. Corby District Council operates a key worker policy which allows companies to nominate a number of workers for rented housing. Many council houses have been purchased and are being refurbished so private houses are well distributed.
